p: Herbacetin is ubiquitous in plants of the genus Rhodiola, such as Rhodiola rosea L. [ 77]. Herbacetin glycosides are also present in the roots of R. sachalinensis A. Bor and show antioxidant activity [ 78]. Veeramani et al. reported that the administration of herbacetin (40â€‰mg/kg p.o.) in mice, with obesity-associated insulin resistance, promotes an increase in the activity of the enzyme glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase, which is directly related to the production of NADPH [ 79].
